trans-unit.target: TEXT_HEAVNA330_01631_SEQ_00<tab>Alphinaud would see this dark chapter in Ul'dah's history brought to a close.

TEXT_HEAVNA330_01631_SEQ_01<tab>Alphinaud is eager to follow Raubahn back to Ul'dah, and witness the beginning of a new chapter in Ul'dahn history. Make your way to the Royal Promenade and present yourself to Bartholomew.

TEXT_HEAVNA330_01631_SEQ_02<tab>With Nanamo's recovery, the chaos engulfing the city should finally give way to calm. Unfortunately, Lord Lolorito has worrying news to share. It would seem the Empire has built a warship to rival the might of the legendary <var 1A 02 /var>Agrius<var 1A 01 /var>. Hot on the heels of this shocking revelation, Alphinaud reveals his intent to disband the Crystal Braves. Inquire as to the thinking behind this momentous resolution.

TEXT_HEAVNA330_01631_SEQ_03<tab>Alphinaud seems at once embarrassed and unburdened by his outpouring of emotion. What shall become of the Crystal Braves now that their commander is set upon the company's dissolution...?
TEXT_HEAVNA330_01631_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Bartholomew on the Royal Promenade.
TEXT_HEAVNA330_01631_ALPHINAUD_000_000<tab>Shall we also make our way to Ul'dah? I should imagine Bartholomew has been instructed to admit us.
TEXT_HEAVNA330_01631_YUGIRI_000_001<tab>“You had killed the one you served...” Ah, pray excuse my mutterings─I was reminded of a line from an old poem.
TEXT_HEAVNA330_01631_BARTHOLOMEW_000_010<tab>Flame General Raubahn mentioned you might be coming. Please, this way if you will.
TEXT_HEAVNA330_01631_YUGIRI_000_011<tab>I hope Lord Lolorito's potion is as effective as he claims...
TEXT_HEAVNA330_01631_ALPHINAUD_000_012<tab>It would appear that the Syndicate has moved swiftly to clear our names. Bartholomew, for one, does not seem remotely surprised by our presence here.
TEXT_HEAVNA330_01631_ALPHINAUD_000_020<tab>I blush to speak thus of mine inner turmoil...

TEXT_HEAVNA330_01631_ALPHINAUD_000_021<tab>But the fact remains: there is no <var 08 E905 ((woman)) ((man)) /var> alive in whom I would rather confide. Were it not for your shining example, I might never have emerged from beneath the pall of my despair.
